16400.name: Eliq Json Parser
16400.description:
Parses some stuff for eliq :).

Don't use this.
16400.release_notes: New way of handling color styles

24398.name: CI HUB Connector
24398.description:
Add images/text to your designs directly from wherever they are, directly in Figma.

Access Stock Images or use your workflow for approval. 

Share with your Team. in Dropbox or Google Drive and more.

And never leave Figma. 


Supports already: Adobe CC Library, Adobe Lightroom, Adobe Stock, Adstream, Aprimo, Box, Brandfolder, Brandmaster, Brandworkz, Bynder, Celum, Censhare, Cliplister, Dash, Dropbox, Eyebase, Fadel, Fotoware, Gelato, Getty Images, Google Drive, Google Photos, Imageshop, Istock, Keepeek, Myview, OneDrive, Opentext, Picturepark, Pimcore, Pixelboxx, Purered, Sharedien, Sharepoint, Shutterstock, SiteFusion, Unsplash, Veeva, Webdam, WIden, Workfront


This is not an official plugin created by Google or Microsoft or any other• It is simply created with ❤️ by CI HUB


STEP 1:

Install the Plugin


STEP 2:

Setup your CI HUB ID at https://ci-hub.com


STEP 3:

Connect to where your Files are and start using.


--------


Visit our CI HUB Academy to learn how to save time in Figma: https://ci-hub.com/academy/


--------


Free Trial, and Subscription Payment:

All first-time users receive a 30-day free trial upon registration/creation of a CI HUB ID.

Payment via credit card is required upon the conclusion of the trial period to continue use. VISIT https://ci-hub.com for all the latest pricing and details. Corporate plans are available on request at sales@ci-hub.com.


Important Notes:

To use the CI HUB Connector to connect to one of the offered third party systems, you may need a login/user account with the selected system. The availability and/or the right to connect to the third-party system is not part of the CI HUB Connector or the CI HUB Services. To use the third-party system, there may be additional cost and/or agreements with the provider of the third-party system needed. CI HUB reserves the right to remove the third-party system from the list of avail. systems or add new third party systems at any time and without notice. To use CI HUB Connector, a full connection to the Internet is required at all times. (Corporate setups with Proxy or Firewalls on request)


To see Demo-Video, Tutorials and more go to https://ci-hub.com/ci-hub-how-to-tutorial/ or visit our Youtube Channel.


We are always here to help you! Let us know any issue, suggestion or feedback: support@ci-hub.com

24756.name: FigmaToCocos
24756.release_notes: 新增: button三种状态、九宫格(可使用9-Slice-Scaling，由于1.6版本的特殊性，因此上下及左右边界需要保持一致)

15818.name: ToAtem
15818.description: Atem Switcher にPNGを送るプラグイン

24137.name: XamlStyles
24137.description:
This plug let you extract all the colors from a design file as XAML resources that are directly embeddable in XAML-compatible application frameworks like WPF, Avalonia, Xamarin Forms, MAUI etc.

XamlStyles supports both solid (as SolidColorBrush) and gradient colors (only LinearGradientBrush), including variations.

24844.name: Juliette - Generate accessible color combinations
24844.description:
Based on your color palette, discover, generate and validate all the accessible color combinations you can have in a fast and easy way.


In this first version, you can generate all the AAA validated color combinations that your color palette allows. 


How to use it:

  1. Install the plugin 
  2. Run the plugin on your Figma File
  3. Define the base color on your color palette. Juliette will generate the extended palette with lighter and darker colours and the combinations available that validate AAA.
  4. Click “Export” and a new page will be created with all the possible combinations.


Stay tuned for the updates!
24844.release_notes:
Now you can remove colors when building your palette!

Oh, and we also made some minor quality of life improvements. Now when you add new colors, the list will automatically scroll to your last added color. Making it easier to follow.

24012.name: Word magnet generator
24012.description:
Turn any text in your FigJam or design file into a set of fridge magnets. Great for writers' block or a team poetry writing jam.


How to use:


  1. Select anything on the canvas with text—any number of text boxes, frames, stickies, shapes, etc.
  2. Run the plugin
  3. Get fridge magnets made from your text! Move around and arrange as you please.

24802.name: Move selection to another page
24802.description: Quickly move selection to the target page.

19127.name: Wantedly Preflight
19127.description:
Wantedly Preflight is a Figma plugin that validates your project satisfies the rules of the design system of Wantedly.


Features

  •  Validation ― You can check whether the node is valid just by running the plugin. The result will come out with a detailed message and you can jump into fixing it immediately with a focus button.
  •  Configurable ― Wantedly Preflight has 6+ sophisticated rule and all of them are well-tested. However, in case if you would like to opt-out of some of the rule in your project, you can independently configure items to enable.
  •  Ignore ― Exceptions are always there. On the result page, you have a check button to ignore the specific node. After you ignored a node, it will always be considered appropriate regardless of whether it violates our rules or not.


Our Design System

See Wantedly UI Components

19593.name: StuDocreator
19593.description:
A small text generator for books, courses and documents.


To generate this text, simply have text fields selected and click on whichever data you want to generate.


Example: If you want to generate a Document Title, select a text field and click on the 'Title' button under the 'Documents' section.

If you want to generate a Book Author, select a text field and click on the 'Author' button under the 'Books' section.


If you would like to generate all the data of a section, for example the Title, Course and Institution of a Document, you need to have three text fields selected each named appropriately. The fields should be named by section and type, so section_type


Example. Select 3 text fields named

  1. document_title
  2. document_course
  3. document_institution

And click on the Document button in the Documents tab. This will generate all information into these text fields.

24716.name: Nouns
24716.description:
Generate random (and daily) nouns and import them as SVG.


Learn more about nouns here.

23862.name: Scrapbook It
23862.description: Use this plugin with this template file to quickly generate a scrapbook! Gather up some photos, pop them in, and share your 'handmade' scrapbook with your parents, grandparents, or team!

24397.name: QPallete Linter Beta
24397.description:
Plugin for checking the correct structure and styles of form layouts that are based on the qpalette design system


The plugin is based on deeply reworked sources of

Design Lint – Figma

24582.name: Trello for Figma
24582.description:
Import your Trello board directly into Figma


Dynamic elements and "drag and drop" included.


Get started with these three easy steps:

  1. Click the link in the plugin to authorise your Trello account and get an authorisation Token.
  2. Paste the token in the Authorisation token field.
  3. Enter the name of the Trello board you want to import in the board name field. Note: the name of the board must be exact, including spacing and spelling.


The plugin is open source, check out the code here:

https://github.com/thomasbrettell/trello-for-figma-plugin


This is an unofficial Trello plugin, not affiliated with Atlassian

24849.name: Replace component
24849.description: Generate a new instance or replace a new instance with an element in the component.

24093.name: Mark the page
24093.description: View the marked pages and quickly enter the marked page!

24845.name: Sympli Pulse
24845.description:
Sympli Pulse is a version tracking application that lets you and your team clearly understand what's going on — even with hundreds of frames and design files — and answer the most painful questions about who changed what and why. You can examine the contents of a file in a layer-by-layer way or inspect your team's activities across all your files to monitor your projects' health from a bird's view.


Single timeline: Sympli Pulse keeps discussions and commits in a single feed and gives you the necessary context to maintain your design files.


Commit Preview: Sympli Pulse helps you create meaningful commits by showing all the changes made to the designs before committing, so you can double-check your commit message and ensure everyone —including developers — is on the same page and no changes are lost.


Detailed tracking: Choose any component or frame on the design to see its history or history of the nearest tracked parent, and subscribe to changes in it. You'll get notified when the new version is published (Notifications are coming soon).
24845.release_notes: Make some texts on UI more clear

24641.name: UX writing status
24641.description:
Keep track of your UX writing copy for each text layer inside a frame.


Allow your team to follow the status of any copy while staying full in context, without leaving Figma.


As a UX writer or product designer, you will be able to identify the progress of the work that is being done for a copy inside a frame, you can set the following status for your text:

To do

In progress

To review

Done


The Plugin will add the status in the name of the layer.


Github
